title: Carlsberg station
text:
Carlsberg station () is an <a href="S-train">S-train</a> <a href="railway%20station">station</a> in <a href="Copenhagen">Copenhagen</a>, <a href="Denmark">Denmark</a>, that serves the <a href="Carlsberg%20%28district%29">Carlsberg</a> area of the <a href="Vesterbro/Kongens%20Enghave">Vesterbro/Kongens Enghave</a> district. Situated on the <a href="Vestbanen%20%28S-tog%29">Høje Taastrup radial</a> of the S-train network, it opened on 3 July 2016 and replaced <a href="Enghave%20station">Enghave station</a>, which was located 200m east.
History.
The station was designed by <a href="Gottlieb%20Paludan%20Architects">Gottlieb Paludan Architects</a> and constructed for the Carlsberg Byen development company between 2014 and 2016, before being handed over to <a href="Banedanmark">Banedanmark</a> and <a href="DSB%20%28railway%20company%29">DSB</a> for operation. It serves the new residential and retail developments on the former <a href="Carlsberg%20brewery">Carlsberg brewery</a> site, as well as the adjacent <a href="University%20College%20Capital">University College Capital</a> campus; it is expected to become one of the five busiest S-train stations in Copenhagen, with approximately 24,000 travellers per day. It is located on the site of the brewery's freight depot, Station Høje, which was in operation from 1937 until 1985.
